meanings.definition: Precisionists: Those who advocate or practice precision, especially in the arts.
meanings.sent1: The precisionists in the art class always paid attention to the smallest details.
meanings.sent2: Art galleries often showcase the works of precisionists who focus on accuracy and detail.
meanings.sent3: The precisionists at the painting competition made sure every brushstroke was perfect.
meanings.sent4: She was a precisionist in her craft, carefully measuring each stroke of the brush.
meanings.sent5: The precisionists' dedication to accuracy made their artwork stand out among the rest.

meanings.definition: Precisionists: A group of American painters who emphasized precise, sharp-edged forms in their work.
meanings.sent1: The precisionists' paintings featured sharp lines and clear shapes.
meanings.sent2: Art history classes often discuss the impact of precisionists on the art world.
meanings.sent3: The precisionists' exhibition drew a large crowd eager to see their detailed artwork.
meanings.sent4: Her style as a precisionist painter was like a laser beam, cutting through the art scene.
meanings.sent5: The precisionists' focus on exactness created a unique visual experience for viewers.
